p: Each experimental unit consisted of a glass flask with 0.8 L capacity, containing 100 g of cowpea grains, free of pests and insecticides. The cowpea grains were submitted to treatments in four replications with LC 50 (5.231 μL L −1 air), LC 25 (3.605 μL L −1 air), LC 10 (2.578 μL L −1 air) and LC 1 (1.448 μL L −1 of air) of V. arborea essential oil. The control had 25 μL of pure solvent (hexane) and grains without treatment. The solutions of each concentration were applied to the filter paper disks, which were placed in Petri dishes covered with organza, and placed on the grains at the base of the flask. Then, 20 unsexed insects were added to each flask.
